       <div class="g post post-728 type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-manly-lists category-manly-skills has_thumb" id="post-728">
        <div class="single_post">
         <div class="breadcrumb" itemprop="breadcrumb">

         <header class="clearfix">
          <h1 class="title single-title">
           7 Essential Survival Skills
          </h1>
          <!-- Start Share Buttons -->
          <div class="shareit top">
           <!-- Twitter -->
           <span class="share-item twitterbtn">
            <a class="twitter-share-button" data-via="" href="https://twitter.com/share">

            </a>
           </span>

            </div>

           </span>

            <su:badge layout="1">
            </su:badge>
           </span>

           <span class="share-item pinbtn">
            <a class="pin-it-button" count-layout="horizontal" href="http://pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=http://smartbeard.com/8-essential-survival-skills/&amp;media=http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/survival-skills1.jpg&amp;description=7 Essential Survival Skills">
             Pin It
            </a>
           </span>
          </div>
          <!-- end Share Buttons -->
         </header>
         <!--.headline_area-->
         <div class="post-single-content box mark-links">
          <p>
           Before you head into the wild there are some basis survival skills that you should be aware of . These are basically techniques that you can use to save yourself, your loved ones or just about anybody from an adverse situation that you may come across.
          </p>
          <p>
           These techniques are meant to provide basic necessities for human life: water, food, shelter, habitat, the ability to think straight, to signal for help, to navigate safely, to avoid unpleasant and possibly fatal interactions with animals and plants, and to cure any incurred injury or ailments
          </p>
          <!-- Quick Adsense WordPress Plugin: http://quicksense.net/ -->
          <div style="float:none;margin:10px 0 10px 0;text-align:center;">
           <script async="" src="//pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js">
           </script>
           <!-- SmartBeard -->
           <ins class="adsbygoogle" data-ad-client="ca-pub-6397082791758583" data-ad-format="auto" data-ad-slot="7538970928" style="display:block">
           </ins>
           <script>
            (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
           </script>
          </div>
          <p>
           Any outdoor activity that you go for like Camping, hiking, hunting etc when you leave the urban world, requires some amount of survival skills
          </p>
          <p>
           Here area list of essential skills that each of us should be aware of
          </p>
          <div class="toc_wrap_right toc_light_blue no_bullets" id="toc_container">
           <p class="toc_title">
            Contents
           </p>

          <h2>
           <span id="7_Essential_Survival_Skills">
            7 Essential Survival Skills
           </span>
          </h2>
          <h2>
           <span id="7_Survival_Cooking">
            7. Survival Cooking
           </span>
          </h2>
          <h2>
           <figure class="hammy-responsive aligncenter wp-image-735 size-full" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/survival-cooking/725396471.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/survival-cooking/3167265385.jpg" title="">
            <noscript>
             <img alt="survival cooking" height="768" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/survival-cooking.jpg" title="" width="1024"/>
            </noscript>
           </figure>
          </h2>
          <p>
           Imagine a situation where youre left out in the wild with no equipment and gas to cook your grub, how will you cook? Well, Im sure you would have heard of the famous statement  necessity is the mother of all invention
          </p>
          <p>
           Did you know a thermos would come of help in this case and act as the piece of cooking equipment. If you know how to boil water. you should be able to easily pull it off with a lot of time.
          </p>
          <p>
           You will need to preheat the thermos with water which helps maintain the heat throughout the thermos which is required for cooking.
          </p>
          <p>
           The items that you can cook are rice, beans, steel cut oats and dried fruits. Obviously, the cooking time will depend on the quality of thermos and the ability to retain its heat along with ingredients youre cooking.
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="6_Starting_a_Fire">
            6. Starting a Fire
           </span>
          </h2>
          <p style="text-align: left;">
           <figure class="hammy-responsive aligncenter wp-image-736 size-full" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/starting-a-fire/3872443154.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/starting-a-fire/3221282073.jpg" title="">
            <noscript>
             <img alt="starting a fire" height="768" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/starting-a-fire.jpg" title="" width="1024"/>
            </noscript>
           </figure>
           Fire is one the most essential things during a survival. The heat provided can help you beat the cold, cook food, dry clothes and most importantly give you the mental strength to survive in an adverse situation. Most of us will know this, but were so used to urbanization that we forget how to start a fire without a lighter or matches.
          </p>
          <p>
           There are many ways to start a fire without matches with few of them being
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            Friction based fire making
           </li>
           <li>
            The Hand Drill
           </li>
           <li>
            Fire Plough
           </li>
           <li>
            Blow Drill
           </li>
           <li>
            Flint &amp; Steel
           </li>
           <li>
            Lens Based methods
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           You can read more about them
           <a href="http://www.artofmanliness.com/2008/04/29/9-ways-to-start-a-fire-without-matches/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-article', 'http://www.artofmanliness.com/2008/04/29/9-ways-to-start-a-fire-without-matches/', 'here']);" target="_blank">
            here
           </a>
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="5_Insulation">
            5. Insulation
           </span>
          </h2>
          <h2>
           <figure class="hammy-responsive aligncenter wp-image-737 size-full" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/survival-shelter/2544879595.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/survival-shelter/6016629.jpg" data-media480="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/survival-shelter/1430945634.jpg" title="">
            <noscript>
             <img alt="OLYMPUS DIGITAL CAMERA" height="960" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/survival-shelter.jpg" title="" width="1280"/>
            </noscript>
           </figure>
          </h2>
          <p>
           In a survival situation, knowing how to insulate yourself and your shelter can make a huge difference. Luckily, when youre out in the wild all alone there are a lot of things you can use to keep yourself warm and secure.
          </p>
          <p>
           Materials like fibrous plant, grass, layers of bark and leaves can be used to insulate yourself as well as create a shelter for yourself.
          </p>
          <p>
           To retain the heat in your shelter you need to use the materials to build a thick layer over an inside your shelter as this will trap the air and build and retain the heat.
          </p>
          <p>
           For yourself, you can use the materials between the layers of your clothing to retain the heat. You should also go ahead and make a mattress for yourself from the materials as this will help you beat the cold which you will get from the ground.
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="4_Making_a_Compass">
            4. Making a Compass
           </span>
          </h2>
          <p>
           <a href="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/compass.jpg">
            <figure class="hammy-responsive alignright size-full wp-image-739" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/compass/197961112.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/compass/2712192276.jpg" data-media480="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/compass/614424657.jpg" title="">
             <noscript>
              <img alt="compass" height="1365" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/compass.jpg" title="" width="2048"/>
             </noscript>
            </figure>
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           When youre in the wild and lost, the best way to find yourself out is through navigation. Were you aware that you cane easily make a compass to guide you in the right direction. This is an essential survival skills to have.
          </p>
          <!-- Quick Adsense WordPress Plugin: http://quicksense.net/ -->
          <div style="float:none;margin:10px 0 10px 0;text-align:center;">
           <script async="" src="//pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js">
           </script>
           <!-- SmartBeard -->
           <ins class="adsbygoogle" data-ad-client="ca-pub-6397082791758583" data-ad-format="auto" data-ad-slot="7538970928" style="display:block">
           </ins>
           <script>
            (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
           </script>
          </div>
          <p>
           Did you know that you could easily make a compass in the wild? Use a little bit of silk or wool from your clothing to magnetize the needle. Rub the needle from eye to point around 100 times and the needle will now be magnetized.
          </p>
          <p>
           Now float the needle on a leaf or piece of paper and you yourself have a compass.
          </p>
          <p>
           Note  This is also one of the most important survival gadgets you can carry in all of your survival stuff
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="3_Mental_Attitude">
            3. Mental Attitude
           </span>
          </h2>
          <p>
           <figure class="hammy-responsive alignright size-full wp-image-740" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/mental-attitude/2912016918.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/mental-attitude/2336345117.jpg" data-media480="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/mental-attitude/2681664682.jpg" title="">
            <noscript>
             <img alt="mental attitude" height="1114" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/mental-attitude.jpg" title="" width="1600"/>
            </noscript>
           </figure>
          </p>
          <p>
           One of the most important factors to get out of an survival situation. You might have the knowledge, skills  but not having the right mental attitude and controlling your emotions will just harm more than help your situation. To be prepared to survive, you need to have the right mental attitude that your situation is helpless and you ultimately chose to survive
          </p>
          <p>
           In a survival situation, fear usually grips us to a point where we are unable to act and take any decisions or you just might base all your decision on fear. Both affect you in an adverse manner.
          </p>
          <p>
           Anyone might get into survival situation at any point in time, there are no guarantees that youll never get into on. The best is to accept your fears and train yourself for facing such situations. Training is always essential as your mind accepts the facts and gets ready to face the situation in hand.When a professional basketball player hits the game winning free throw, its not because he was born to play basketball. Its because he spent hundreds maybe even thousands of hours shooting free throws. When the time came to make the shot, he made it because he made that same shot ten thousand times before.
          </p>
          <p>
           So, you can easily train your mind by doing things over and over again.
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="2_Water">
            2. Water
           </span>
          </h2>
          <p>
           <figure class="hammy-responsive alignright size-full wp-image-741" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/water/2015484959.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/water/1072977288.jpg" data-media480="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/water/3263902011.jpg" title="">
            <noscript>
             <img alt="water" height="2048" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/water.jpg" title="" width="1365"/>
            </noscript>
           </figure>
          </p>
          <p>
           You can easily find water out in the wild. You just need to remember that almost any environment has water present to some degree. You just need to ensure that you purify the water before drinking it.
          </p>
          <p>
           The basic process of filtering water in a survival situation is to remove debris such as soil, dirt, sediment, sticks, leaves and any animals living in the water. If you have two container, you can easily fill one with water and then use your shirt or some other piece of cloth to filter the basic debris while poring into the other container
          </p>
          <p>
           If you do not have a cup, can or other type of container, improvise one from plastic or water-resistant cloth. Shape the plastic or cloth into a bowl by pleating it. Use pins or even your hands to hold the pleats.
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="1_First_Aid">
            1. First Aid
           </span>
          </h2>
          <p>
           <figure class="hammy-responsive alignright size-full wp-image-742" data-media="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/first-aid/1878217874.jpg" data-media320="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/first-aid/3044493545.jpg" data-media480="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/cache/2014/09/first-aid/2663719417.jpg" title="">
            <noscript>
             <img alt="first aid" height="2048" src="http://smartbeard.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/first-aid.jpg" title="" width="1365"/>
            </noscript>
           </figure>
          </p>
          <p>
           When youre out there its important to learn about first aid. First -Aid skills are something that everyone should know as you can help yourself to an extent or just save somebody elses life in the process.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            a. Cleaning &amp; dressing wounds
           </strong>
            Having the right skill to disinfect and bandage wounds apart from having a first aid kit is really very important
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            b. Making a Makeshift spling or shift
           </strong>
            One of the most important first aid skills to learn would be making your own makeshift splints or slings for broken bones. Broken bones and sprains are inevitable injuries that need first aid especially in a outdoor survival or emergency situation, the main key to a fast recovery would be protecting and avoiding further damage by completely immobilizing the part where the injury is.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            c. CPR
           </strong>
            Used to help victims with cardiac arrest
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            d. Heimlich Maneuver
           </strong>
            Used to assist victims that are choking
          </p>
          <h2>
           <span id="Summary">
            Summary
           </span>
          </h2>
          <p>
           So there you have it, a list of 7 essential survival skills in no particular order which will help you in any adverse or emergency situation
          </p>
